SR. GRAPHICS DESIGNER

SUMMARY

I have been working as a graphic designer for Vanderbilt University for  twenty years.
Additionally since 2013, I have been supervising/advising a team of anywhere from ten to 17 student designers who perform work for Vanderbilt students and student groups.
Highlights
InDesign Photoshop Illustrator Quark
Microsoft Word, Acrobat Designing in four-color Photo manipulation and retouching Illustration and wordmark design

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Association of College Unions International
First Place for Best Calendar 2006-07 from Association of College Unions
International -Region 5
First Place for Great Performances at Vanderbilt 2001-02 brochure from Association
of College Unions International
Second Place for Homecoming Ad 2001-02 from Association of College Unions
International

<JD_START>
Job Title: Packaging Graphic Designer

Location: Atlanta Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Case-Mate is seeking a talented Packaging Graphic Designer to join our packaging team. This role includes packaging development, design and preparing production artwork. Case-Mate is a fast-paced, nimble and entrepreneurial company with huge growth potential. Working here you will have the unique opportunity to work on a diverse range of packaging projects across many different product categories, brands and a variety of brand licenses.
This is a full-time in-office role (not hybrid or remote), located at our Sandy Springs-based headquarters.
Please provide a copy of your resume and portfolio. Resumes without a portfolio will NOT be considered.
Responsibilities include:Ability to conceptualize, design and execute unique, fashion-forward packaging for our branded products Create innovative and impactful retail and e-commerce packaging solutions that inspire consumer purchase decisionsEffectively communicate product features and benefitsStrong command of visual design capabilities, including composition, layout, information hierarchy, typography, and color judgmentDevelop and maintain packaging files to ensure their compliance with brand standards and make necessary revisions to packaging artwork Produce factory ready, final print files for productionAbility to follow brand style guidesStrong design, verbal, organizational, and time management skillsWork under strict and tight deadlines in a fast-paced environmentStrong Adobe Creative Suite skills (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign)
QualificationsWe are looking for a highly motivated, energetic individual with a positive attitude.Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design or Related Field3+ years’ experience with a background in packaging design with a strong understanding of brand/graphic design and packaging productionPortfolio submission of work as primary designer showcasing ability to conceptualize, design and execute current packaging (folding cartons, blister cards, etc.) required with applicationProficiency with Adobe Creative Suite for Mac – Illustrator & Photoshop requiredExperience with 3D programs such as Keyshot, Blender, Substance 3D and Product Photography is a plusFamiliarity with licensing brands and following brand guidelines a plusPossess exceptional time management skills; ability to think under pressure and adhere to tight deadlinesAuthorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
